verses.content: وَجَاءَ مِنْ أَقْصَى الْمَدِينَةِ رَجُلٌ يَسْعَىٰ قَالَ يَا قَوْمِ اتَّبِعُوا الْمُرْسَلِينَ
verses.translation: At that, a man came running from the farthest end of the city, [and] exclaimed: “O my people! Follow these message-bearers!

verses.content: اتَّبِعُوا مَن لَّا يَسْأَلُكُمْ أَجْرًا وَهُم مُّهْتَدُونَ
verses.translation: Follow those who ask no reward of you, and themselves are rightly guided!

verses.content: وَمَا لِيَ لَا أَعْبُدُ الَّذِي فَطَرَنِي وَإِلَيْهِ تُرْجَعُونَ
verses.translation: “[As for me,] why should I not worship Him who has brought me into being, and to whom you all will be brought back?

verses.content: أَأَتَّخِذُ مِن دُونِهِ آلِهَةً إِن يُرِدْنِ الرَّحْمَـٰنُ بِضُرٍّ لَّا تُغْنِ عَنِّي شَفَاعَتُهُمْ شَيْئًا وَلَا يُنقِذُونِ
verses.translation: Should I take to worship­ping [other] deities beside Him? [But then,] if the Most Gracious should will that harm befall me, their intercession could not in the least avail me, nor could they save me:

verses.content: إِنِّي إِذًا لَّفِي ضَلَالٍ مُّبِينٍ
verses.translation: and so, behold, I would have indeed, most obviously, lost myself in error!

verses.content: إِنِّي آمَنتُ بِرَبِّكُمْ فَاسْمَعُونِ
verses.translation: “Verily, [O my people,] in the Sustainer of you all have I come to believe: listen, then, to me!”

verses.content: قِيلَ ادْخُلِ الْجَنَّةَ ۖ قَالَ يَا لَيْتَ قَوْمِي يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.translation: [And] he was told, “[Thou shalt] enter paradise!” - [whereupon] he exclaimed: “Would that my people knew

verses.content: بِمَا غَفَرَ لِي رَبِّي وَجَعَلَنِي مِنَ الْمُكْرَمِينَ
verses.translation: how my Sustainer has forgiven me [the sins of my past], and has placed me among the honoured ones!”

verses.content: وَمَا أَنزَلْنَا عَلَىٰ قَوْمِهِ مِن بَعْدِهِ مِن جُندٍ مِّنَ السَّمَاءِ وَمَا كُنَّا مُنزِلِينَ
verses.translation: And after that, no host out of heaven did We send down against his people, nor did We need to send down any:

verses.content: إِن كَانَتْ إِلَّا صَيْحَةً وَاحِدَةً فَإِذَا هُمْ خَامِدُونَ
verses.translation: nothing was [needed] but one single blast [of Our punishment] - and lo! they became as still and silent as ashes.

verses.content: يَا حَسْرَةً عَلَى الْعِبَادِ ۚ مَا يَأْتِيهِم مِّن رَّسُولٍ إِلَّا كَانُوا بِهِ يَسْتَهْزِئُونَ
verses.translation: OH, THE REGRETS that [most] human beings will have to bear! Never has an apostle come to them without their deriding him!

verses.content: أَلَمْ يَرَوْا كَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا قَبْلَهُم مِّنَ الْقُرُونِ أَنَّهُمْ إِلَيْهِمْ لَا يَرْجِعُونَ
verses.translation: Are they not aware of how many a generation We have destroyed before their time, [and] that those [that have perished] will never return to them,

verses.content: وَإِن كُلٌّ لَّمَّا جَمِيعٌ لَّدَيْنَا مُحْضَرُونَ
verses.translation: and [that] all of them, all together, will [in the end] before Us be arraigned?

verses.content: وَآيَةٌ لَّهُمُ الْأَرْضُ الْمَيْتَةُ أَحْيَيْنَاهَا وَأَخْرَجْنَا مِنْهَا حَبًّا فَمِنْهُ يَأْكُلُونَ
verses.translation: And [yet,] they have a sign [of Our power to create and to resurrect] in the lifeless earth which We make alive, and out of which We bring forth grain, whereof they may eat;

verses.content: وَجَعَلْنَا فِيهَا جَنَّاتٍ مِّن نَّخِيلٍ وَأَعْنَابٍ وَفَجَّرْنَا فِيهَا مِنَ الْعُيُونِ
verses.translation: and [how] We make gardens of date-palms and vines [grow] thereon, and cause springs to gush [forth] within it,

verses.content: لِيَأْكُلُوا مِن ثَمَرِهِ وَمَا عَمِلَتْهُ أَيْدِيهِمْ ۖ أَفَلَا يَشْكُرُونَ
verses.translation: so that they may eat of the fruit thereof, though it was not their hands that made it. Will they not, then, be grateful?

verses.content: سُبْحَانَ الَّذِي خَلَقَ الْأَزْوَاجَ كُلَّهَا مِمَّا تُنبِتُ الْأَرْضُ وَمِنْ أَنفُسِهِمْ وَمِمَّا لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.translation: Limitless in His glory is He who has created opposites in whatever the earth produces, and in men’s own selves, and in that of which [as yet] they have no knowledge.

verses.content: وَآيَةٌ لَّهُمُ اللَّيْلُ نَسْلَخُ مِنْهُ النَّهَارَ فَإِذَا هُم مُّظْلِمُونَ
verses.translation: And [of Our sway over all that exists] they have a sign in the night: We withdraw from it the [light of] day - and lo! they are in darkness.

verses.content: وَالشَّمْسُ تَجْرِي لِمُسْتَقَرٍّ لَّهَا ۚ ذَٰلِكَ تَقْدِيرُ الْعَزِيزِ الْعَلِيمِ
verses.translation: And [they have a sign in] the sun: it runs in an orbit of its own [and] that is laid down by the will of the Almighty, the All-Knowing;

verses.content: وَالْقَمَرَ قَدَّرْنَاهُ مَنَازِلَ حَتَّىٰ عَادَ كَالْعُرْجُونِ الْقَدِيمِ
verses.translation: and [in] the moon, for which We have determined phases [which it must traverse] till it becomes like an old date-stalk, dried-up and curved:

verses.content: لَا الشَّمْسُ يَنبَغِي لَهَا أَن تُدْرِكَ الْقَمَرَ وَلَا اللَّيْلُ سَابِقُ النَّهَارِ ۚ وَكُلٌّ فِي فَلَكٍ يَسْبَحُونَ
verses.translation: [and] neither may the sun overtake the moon, nor can the night usurp the time of day, since all of them float through space [in accordance with Our laws].

verses.content: وَآيَةٌ لَّهُمْ أَنَّا حَمَلْنَا ذُرِّيَّتَهُمْ فِي الْفُلْكِ الْمَشْحُونِ
verses.translation: And [it ought to be] a sign for them that We bear their offspring [over the seas] in laden ships,

verses.content: وَخَلَقْنَا لَهُم مِّن مِّثْلِهِ مَا يَرْكَبُونَ
verses.translation: and [that] We create for them things of a similar kind, on which they may embark [in their travels];

verses.content: وَإِن نَّشَأْ نُغْرِقْهُمْ فَلَا صَرِيخَ لَهُمْ وَلَا هُمْ يُنقَذُونَ
verses.translation: and [that,] if such be Our will, We may cause them to drown, with none to respond to their cry for help: and [then] they cannot be saved,

verses.content: إِلَّا رَحْمَةً مِّنَّا وَمَتَاعًا إِلَىٰ حِينٍ
verses.translation: unless it be by an act of mercy from Us and a grant of life for a [further span of] time.

verses.content: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمُ اتَّقُوا مَا بَيْنَ أَيْدِيكُمْ وَمَا خَلْفَكُمْ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُرْحَمُونَ
verses.translation: And [yet,] when they are told, “Beware of [God’s insight into] all that lies open before you and all that is hidden from you, so that you might be graced with His mercy,” [most men choose to remain deaf;]

verses.content: وَمَا تَأْتِيهِم مِّنْ آيَةٍ مِّنْ آيَاتِ رَبِّهِمْ إِلَّا كَانُوا عَنْهَا مُعْرِضِينَ
verses.translation: and no message of their Sustainer s messages ever reaches them without their turning away from it.

verses.content: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمْ أَنفِقُوا مِمَّا رَزَقَكُمُ اللَّهُ قَالَ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا لِلَّذِينَ آمَنُوا أَنُطْعِمُ مَن لَّوْ يَشَاءُ اللَّهُ أَطْعَمَهُ إِنْ أَنتُمْ إِلَّا فِي ضَلَالٍ مُّبِينٍ
verses.translation: Thus, when they are told, “Spend on others out of what God has provided for you as sus­tenance,” those who are bent on denying the truth say unto those who believe, “Shall we feed anyone whom, if [your] God had so willed, He could have fed [Himself]? Clearly, you are but lost in error!”

verses.content: وَيَقُولُونَ مَتَىٰ هَـٰذَا الْوَعْدُ إِن كُنتُمْ صَادِقِينَ
verses.translation: And they add, “When is this promise [of resurrection] to be fulfilled? [Answer this] if you are men of truth!”

verses.content: مَا يَنظُرُونَ إِلَّا صَيْحَةً وَاحِدَةً تَأْخُذُهُمْ وَهُمْ يَخِصِّمُونَ
verses.translation: [And they are unaware that] nothing awaits them beyond a single blast [of God’s punishment], which will overtake them while they are still arguing - [against resurrection]:

verses.content: فَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ تَوْصِيَةً وَلَا إِلَىٰ أَهْلِهِمْ يَرْجِعُونَ
verses.translation: and so [sudden will be their end that] no testament will they be able to make, - nor to their own people will they return!

verses.content: وَنُفِخَ فِي الصُّورِ فَإِذَا هُم مِّنَ الْأَجْدَاثِ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِمْ يَنسِلُونَ
verses.translation: And [then] the trumpet [of resurrection] will be blown - and lo! out of their graves towards their Sustainer will they all rush forth!

verses.content: قَالُوا يَا وَيْلَنَا مَن بَعَثَنَا مِن مَّرْقَدِنَا ۜ ۗ هَـٰذَا مَا وَعَدَ الرَّحْمَـٰنُ وَصَدَقَ الْمُرْسَلُونَ
verses.translation: They will say: “Oh, woe unto us! Who has roused us from our sleep [of death]?” [Whereupon they will be told:] “This is what the Most Gracious has promised! And His message-bearers spoke the truth!”

verses.content: إِن كَانَتْ إِلَّا صَيْحَةً وَاحِدَةً فَإِذَا هُمْ جَمِيعٌ لَّدَيْنَا مُحْضَرُونَ
verses.translation: Nothing will there have been but one single blast - and lo! before Us will all of them be arraigned [and be told]:

verses.content: فَالْيَوْمَ لَا تُظْلَمُ نَفْسٌ شَيْئًا وَلَا تُجْزَوْنَ إِلَّا مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
verses.translation: “Today, then, no human being shall be wronged in the least, nor shalt you be requited for aught but what you were doing [on earth].

verses.content: إِنَّ أَصْحَابَ الْجَنَّةِ الْيَوْمَ فِي شُغُلٍ فَاكِهُونَ
verses.translation: “Behold, those who are destined for paradise shall today have joy in whatever they do:

verses.content: هُمْ وَأَزْوَاجُهُمْ فِي ظِلَالٍ عَلَى الْأَرَائِكِ مُتَّكِئُونَ
verses.translation: in happiness will they and their spouses on couches recline;

verses.content: لَهُمْ فِيهَا فَاكِهَةٌ وَلَهُم مَّا يَدَّعُونَ
verses.translation: [only] delight will there be for them, and theirs shall be all that they could ask for:

verses.content: سَلَامٌ قَوْلًا مِّن رَّبٍّ رَّحِيمٍ
verses.translation: peace and fulfillment through the word of a Sustainer who dispenses all grace.

verses.content: وَامْتَازُوا الْيَوْمَ أَيُّهَا الْمُجْرِمُونَ
verses.translation: “But stand aside today, O you who were lost in sin!

verses.content: أَلَمْ أَعْهَدْ إِلَيْكُمْ يَا بَنِي آدَمَ أَن لَّا تَعْبُدُوا الشَّيْطَانَ ۖ إِنَّهُ لَكُمْ عَدُوٌّ مُّبِينٌ
verses.translation: Did I not enjoin on you, O you children of Adam, that you should not worship Satan – since, verily, he is your open foe

verses.content: وَأَنِ اعْبُدُونِي ۚ هَـٰذَا صِرَاطٌ مُّسْتَقِيمٌ
verses.translation: and that you should worship Me [alone]? This would have been a straight way!

verses.content: وَلَقَدْ أَضَلَّ مِنكُمْ جِبِلًّا كَثِيرًا ۖ أَفَلَمْ تَكُونُوا تَعْقِلُونَ
verses.translation: And [as for Satan -] he had already led astray a great many of you: could you not, then, use your reason?

verses.content: هَـٰذِهِ جَهَنَّمُ الَّتِي كُنتُمْ تُوعَدُونَ
verses.translation: “This, then, is the hell of which you were warned again and again:

verses.content: اصْلَوْهَا الْيَوْمَ بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَكْفُرُونَ
verses.translation: endure it today as an outcome of your persistent denial of the truth!”

verses.content: الْيَوْمَ نَخْتِمُ عَلَىٰ أَفْوَاهِهِمْ وَتُكَلِّمُنَا أَيْدِيهِمْ وَتَشْهَدُ أَرْجُلُهُم بِمَا كَانُوا يَكْسِبُونَ
verses.translation: On that Day We shall set a seal on their mouths but their hands will speak unto Us, and their feet will bear witness to whatever they have earned [in life].

verses.content: وَلَوْ نَشَاءُ لَطَمَسْنَا عَلَىٰ أَعْيُنِهِمْ فَاسْتَبَقُوا الصِّرَاطَ فَأَنَّىٰ يُبْصِرُونَ
verses.translation: NOW HAD IT BEEN Our will [that men should not be able to discern between right and wrong], We could surely have deprived them of their sight, so that they would stray forever from the [right] way: for how could they have had insight [into what is true]?

verses.content: وَلَوْ نَشَاءُ لَمَسَخْنَاهُمْ عَلَىٰ مَكَانَتِهِمْ فَمَا اسْتَطَاعُوا مُضِيًّا وَلَا يَرْجِعُونَ
verses.translation: And had it been Our will [that they should not be free to choose between right and wrong], We could surely have given them a different nature [and created them as beings rooted] in their places, so that they would not be able to move forward, and could not turn back.]

verses.content: وَمَن نُّعَمِّرْهُ نُنَكِّسْهُ فِي الْخَلْقِ ۖ أَفَلَا يَعْقِلُونَ
verses.translation: But [let them always remember that] if We lengthen a human being’s days, We also cause him to decline in his powers [when he grows old]: will they not, then, use their reason?

verses.content: وَمَا عَلَّمْنَاهُ الشِّعْرَ وَمَا يَنبَغِي لَهُ ۚ إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا ذِكْرٌ وَقُرْآنٌ مُّبِينٌ
verses.translation: AND [thus it is:] We have not imparted to this [Prophet the gift of] poetry, nor would [poetry] have suited this [message]: it is but a reminder and a [divine] discourse, clear in itself and clearly showing the truth,

verses.content: لِّيُنذِرَ مَن كَانَ حَيًّا وَيَحِقَّ الْقَوْلُ عَلَى الْكَافِرِينَ
verses.translation: to the end that it may warn everyone who is alive [of heart], and that the word [of God] may bear witness against all who deny the truth.

verses.content: أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا أَنَّا خَلَقْنَا لَهُم مِّمَّا عَمِلَتْ أَيْدِينَا أَنْعَامًا فَهُمْ لَهَا مَالِكُونَ
verses.translation: Are they, then, not aware that it is for them that We have created, among all the things which Our hands have wrought, the domestic animals of which they are [now] masters? –

verses.content: وَذَلَّلْنَاهَا لَهُمْ فَمِنْهَا رَكُوبُهُمْ وَمِنْهَا يَأْكُلُونَ
verses.translation: and that We have subjected them to men’s will, so that some of them they may use for riding and of some they may eat,

verses.content: وَلَهُمْ فِيهَا مَنَافِعُ وَمَشَارِبُ ۖ أَفَلَا يَشْكُرُونَ
verses.translation: and may have [yet other] benefits from them, and [milk] to drink? Will they not, then, be grateful? (

verses.content: وَاتَّخَذُوا مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ آلِهَةً لَّعَلَّهُمْ يُنصَرُونَ
verses.translation: But [nay,] they take to worshipping deities other than God, [hoping] to be succoured [by them, and not knowing that]

verses.content: لَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ نَصْرَهُمْ وَهُمْ لَهُمْ جُندٌ مُّحْضَرُونَ
verses.translation: they are unable to succour their devotees, even though to them they may [appear to] be hosts drawn up [for succour].

verses.content: فَلَا يَحْزُنكَ قَوْلُهُمْ ۘ إِنَّا نَعْلَمُ مَا يُسِرُّونَ وَمَا يُعْلِنُونَ
verses.translation: However, be not grieved by the sayings of those [who deny the truth]: verily, We know all that they keep secret as well as all that they bring into the open.

verses.content: أَوَلَمْ يَرَ الْإِنسَانُ أَنَّا خَلَقْنَاهُ مِن نُّطْفَةٍ فَإِذَا هُوَ خَصِيمٌ مُّبِينٌ
verses.translation: IS MAN, then, not aware that it is We who create him out of a [mere] drop of sperm - whereupon, lo! he shows himself endowed with the power to think and to argue?

verses.content: وَضَرَبَ لَنَا مَثَلًا وَنَسِيَ خَلْقَهُ ۖ قَالَ مَن يُحْيِي الْعِظَامَ وَهِيَ رَمِيمٌ
verses.translation: And [now] he [argues about Us, and] thinks of Us in terms of comparison, and is oblivious of how he himself was created! [And so] he says, “Who could give life to bones that have crumbled to dust?”

verses.content: قُلْ يُحْيِيهَا الَّذِي أَنشَأَهَا أَوَّلَ مَرَّةٍ ۖ وَهُوَ بِكُلِّ خَلْقٍ عَلِيمٌ
verses.translation: Say: “He who brought them into being in the first instance will give them life [once again], seeing that He has full knowledge of every act of creation:

verses.content: الَّذِي جَعَلَ لَكُم مِّنَ الشَّجَرِ الْأَخْضَرِ نَارًا فَإِذَا أَنتُم مِّنْهُ تُوقِدُونَ
verses.translation: He who produces for you fire out of the green tree, so that, lo! you kindle [your fires] therewith.”

verses.content: أَوَلَيْسَ الَّذِي خَلَقَ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ بِقَادِرٍ عَلَىٰ أَن يَخْلُقَ مِثْلَهُم ۚ بَلَىٰ وَهُوَ الْخَلَّاقُ الْعَلِيمُ
verses.translation: Is, then, He who has created the heavens and the earth not able to create [anew] the like of those [who have died]? Yea, indeed - for He alone is the all-knowing Crea­tor:

verses.content: إِنَّمَا أَمْرُهُ إِذَا أَرَادَ شَيْئًا أَن يَقُولَ لَهُ كُن فَيَكُونُ
verses.translation: His Being alone is such that when He wills a thing to be, He but says unto it, “Be” — and it is.

verses.content: فَسُبْحَانَ الَّذِي بِيَدِهِ مَلَكُوتُ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ وَإِلَيْهِ تُرْجَعُونَ
verses.translation: Limitless, then, in His glory is He in whose hand rests the mighty dominion over all things; and unto Him you all will be brought back!

verses.content: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالصَّافَّاتِ صَفًّا
verses.translation: CONSIDER these [messages] ranged in serried ranks,

verses.content: فَالزَّاجِرَاتِ زَجْرًا
verses.translation: and restraining [from evil] by a call to restraint,

verses.content: فَالتَّالِيَاتِ ذِكْرًا
verses.translation: and conveying [to all the world] a reminder:

verses.content: إِنَّ إِلَـٰهَكُمْ لَوَاحِدٌ
verses.translation: Verily, most surely, your God is One –

verses.content: رَّبُّ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا وَرَبُّ الْمَشَارِقِ
verses.translation: the Sustainer of the heavens and the earth and of all that is between them, and the Sustainer of all the points of sunrise!

verses.content: إِنَّا زَيَّنَّا السَّمَاءَ الدُّنْيَا بِزِينَةٍ الْكَوَاكِبِ
verses.translation: Behold, We have adorned the skies nearest to the earth with the beauty of stars,

verses.content: وَحِفْظًا مِّن كُلِّ شَيْطَانٍ مَّارِدٍ
verses.translation: and have made them secure against every rebellious, satanic force,

verses.content: لَّا يَسَّمَّعُونَ إِلَى الْمَلَإِ الْأَعْلَىٰ وَيُقْذَفُونَ مِن كُلِّ جَانِبٍ
verses.translation: [so that] they [who seek to learn the unknowable] should not be able to overhear the host on high, but shall be repelled from all sides,

verses.content: دُحُورًا ۖ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابٌ وَاصِبٌ
verses.translation: cast out [from all grace], with lasting suffering in store for them [in the life to come];

verses.content: إِلَّا مَنْ خَطِفَ الْخَطْفَةَ فَأَتْبَعَهُ شِهَابٌ ثَاقِبٌ
verses.translation: but if anyone does succeed in snatching a glimpse [of such knowledge], he is [henceforth] pursued by a piercing flame.

verses.content: فَاسْتَفْتِهِمْ أَهُمْ أَشَدُّ خَلْقًا أَم مَّنْ خَلَقْنَا ۚ إِنَّا خَلَقْنَاهُم مِّن طِينٍ لَّازِبٍ
verses.translation: AND NOW ask those [who deny the truth] to enlight­en thee: Were they more difficult to create than all those [untold marvels] that We have created? - for, behold, them have We created out of [mere] clay commingled with water!

verses.content: بَلْ عَجِبْتَ وَيَسْخَرُونَ
verses.translation: Nay, but whereas thou dost marvel, they [only] scoff;

verses.content: وَإِذَا ذُكِّرُوا لَا يَذْكُرُونَ
verses.translation: and when they are reminded [of the truth], they refuse to take it to heart;

verses.content: وَإِذَا رَأَوْا آيَةً يَسْتَسْخِرُونَ
verses.translation: and when they become aware of a [divine] message, they turn it to ridicule

verses.content: وَقَالُوا إِنْ هَـٰذَا إِلَّا سِحْرٌ مُّبِينٌ
verses.translation: and say: “This is clearly nothing but [a mortal’s] spellbinding eloquence!

verses.content: أَإِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًا وَعِظَامًا أَإِنَّا لَمَبْعُوثُونَ
verses.translation: Why - after we have died and become mere dust and bones, shall we, forsooth, be raised from the dead? –

verses.content: أَوَآبَاؤُنَا الْأَوَّلُونَ
verses.translation: and perhaps also our forebears of old?”

verses.content: قُلْ نَعَمْ وَأَنتُمْ دَاخِرُونَ
verses.translation: Say: “Yea, indeed - and most abject will you then be!” –

verses.content: فَإِنَّمَا هِيَ زَجْرَةٌ وَاحِدَةٌ فَإِذَا هُمْ يَنظُرُونَ
verses.translation: for that [resurrection which they deride] will be [upon them of a sudden, as if it were] but a single accusing cry - and then, lo! they will begin to see [the truth]

verses.content: وَقَالُوا يَا وَيْلَنَا هَـٰذَا يَوْمُ الدِّينِ
verses.translation: and will say: “Oh, woe unto us! This is the Day of Judgment!”

verses.content: هَـٰذَا يَوْمُ الْفَصْلِ الَّذِي كُنتُم بِهِ تُكَذِّبُونَ
verses.translation: [And they will be told:] “This is the Day of Distinction [between the true and the false - the Day] which you were wont to call a lie!”

verses.content: احْشُرُوا الَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا وَأَزْوَاجَهُمْ وَمَا كَانُوا يَعْبُدُونَ
verses.translation: [And God will thus command:] “Assemble all those who were bent on evildoing, together with others of their ilk and [with] all that they were wont to worship

verses.content: مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ فَاهْدُوهُمْ إِلَىٰ صِرَاطِ الْجَحِيمِ
verses.translation: instead of God, and lead them all onto the way to the blazing fire,

verses.content: وَقِفُوهُمْ ۖ إِنَّهُم مَّسْئُولُونَ
verses.translation: and halt them [there]!” [And then,] behold, they shall be asked,

verses.content: مَا لَكُمْ لَا تَنَاصَرُونَ
verses.translation: “How is it that [now] you cannot succour one another?”

verses.content: بَلْ هُمُ الْيَوْمَ مُسْتَسْلِمُونَ
verses.translation: Nay, but on that Day they would willingly surrender [to God];

verses.content: وَأَقْبَلَ بَعْضُهُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ يَتَسَاءَلُونَ
verses.translation: but [since it will be too late,] they will turn upon one another, demanding of each other [to relieve them of the burden of their past sins].

verses.content: قَالُوا إِنَّكُمْ كُنتُمْ تَأْتُونَنَا عَنِ الْيَمِينِ
verses.translation: Some [of them] will say: “Behold, you were wont to approach us [deceptively] from the right!”

verses.content: قَالُوا بَل لَّمْ تَكُونُوا مُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.translation: [To which] the others will reply: “Nay, you yourselves were bereft of all faith!

verses.content: وَمَا كَانَ لَنَا عَلَيْكُم مِّن سُلْطَانٍ ۖ بَلْ كُنتُمْ قَوْمًا طَاغِينَ
verses.translation: Moreover, we had no power at all over you: nay, you were people filled with overweening arrogance!

verses.content: فَحَقَّ عَلَيْنَا قَوْلُ رَبِّنَا ۖ إِنَّا لَذَائِقُونَ
verses.translation: But now our Sustainer’s word has come true against us [as well]: verily, we are bound to taste [the fruit of our sins].

verses.content: فَأَغْوَيْنَاكُمْ إِنَّا كُنَّا غَاوِينَ
verses.translation: So then, [if it be true that] we have caused you to err grievously - behold, we ourselves had been lost in grievous error!”

verses.content: فَإِنَّهُمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ فِي الْعَذَابِ مُشْتَرِكُونَ
verses.translation: And, verily, on that Day they all will share in their common suffering.

verses.content: إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَفْعَلُ بِالْمُجْرِمِينَ
verses.translation: Verily, thus shall We deal with all who were lost in sin:

verses.content: إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا إِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمْ لَا إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ يَسْتَكْبِرُونَ
verses.translation: for, behold, whenever they were told, “There is no deity save God,” they would glory in their arrogance

verses.content: وَيَقُولُونَ أَئِنَّا لَتَارِكُو آلِهَتِنَا لِشَاعِرٍ مَّجْنُونٍ
verses.translation: and would say, “Shall we, then, give up our deities at the bidding of a mad poet?”

verses.content: بَلْ جَاءَ بِالْحَقِّ وَصَدَّقَ الْمُرْسَلِينَ
verses.translation: Nay, but he [whom you call a mad poet] has brought the truth; and he confirms the truth of [what the earlier of God’s] message-bearers [have taught].

verses.content: إِنَّكُمْ لَذَائِقُو الْعَذَابِ الْأَلِيمِ
verses.translation: Behold, you will indeed taste grievous suffering [in the life to come],

verses.content: وَمَا تُجْزَوْنَ إِلَّا مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
verses.translation: although you shall not be requited for aught but what you were wont to do.

verses.content: إِلَّا عِبَادَ اللَّهِ الْمُخْلَصِينَ
verses.translation: Not so, however, God’s true servants:

verses.content: أُولَـٰئِكَ لَهُمْ رِزْقٌ مَّعْلُومٌ
verses.translation: [in the hereafter,] theirs shall be a sustenance which they will recognize

verses.content: فَوَاكِهُ ۖ وَهُم مُّكْرَمُونَ
verses.translation: as the fruits [of their life on earth]; and honoured shall they be

verses.content: فِي جَنَّاتِ النَّعِيمِ
verses.translation: in gardens of bliss,

verses.content: عَلَىٰ سُرُرٍ مُّتَقَابِلِينَ
verses.translation: facing one another [in love] upon thrones of happiness.

verses.content: يُطَافُ عَلَيْهِم بِكَأْسٍ مِّن مَّعِينٍ
verses.translation: A cup will be passed round among them [with a drink] from unsullied springs,

verses.content: بَيْضَاءَ لَذَّةٍ لِّلشَّارِبِينَ
verses.translation: clear, delightful to those who drink it:

verses.content: لَا فِيهَا غَوْلٌ وَلَا هُمْ عَنْهَا يُنزَفُونَ
verses.translation: no headiness will be in it, and they will not get drunk thereon.

verses.content: وَعِندَهُمْ قَاصِرَاتُ الطَّرْفِ عِينٌ
verses.translation: And with them will be mates of modest gaze, most beautiful of eye,

verses.content: كَأَنَّهُنَّ بَيْضٌ مَّكْنُونٌ
verses.translation: [as free of faults] as if they were hidden [ostrich] eggs.

verses.content: فَأَقْبَلَ بَعْضُهُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ يَتَسَاءَلُونَ
verses.translation: And they will all turn to one another, asking each other [about their past lives].

verses.content: قَالَ قَائِلٌ مِّنْهُمْ إِنِّي كَانَ لِي قَرِينٌ
verses.translation: One of them speaks thus: “Behold, I had [on earth] a close companion

verses.content: يَقُولُ أَإِنَّكَ لَمِنَ الْمُصَدِّقِينَ
verses.translation: who was wont to ask [me], ‘Why - art thou really one of those who believe it to be true

verses.content: أَإِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًا وَعِظَامًا أَإِنَّا لَمَدِينُونَ
verses.translation: [that] after we have died and become mere dust and bones we shall, forsooth, be brought to judgment?”’

verses.content: قَالَ هَلْ أَنتُم مُّطَّلِعُونَ
verses.translation: [And] he adds: “Would you like to look [and see him]?” –

verses.content: فَاطَّلَعَ فَرَآهُ فِي سَوَاءِ الْجَحِيمِ
verses.translation: and then he looks and sees that [companion of his] in the midst of the blazing fire,

verses.content: قَالَ تَاللَّهِ إِن كِدتَّ لَتُرْدِينِ
verses.translation: and says: “By God! Verily, thou hast almost destroyed me [too, O my erstwhile companion]

verses.content: وَلَوْلَا نِعْمَةُ رَبِّي لَكُنتُ مِنَ الْمُحْضَرِينَ
verses.translation: for had it not been for my Sustainer’s favour, I would surely be [now] among those who are given over [to suffering]!

verses.content: أَفَمَا نَحْنُ بِمَيِّتِينَ
verses.translation: But then, [O my friends in paradise,] is it [really] so that we are not to die

verses.content: إِلَّا مَوْتَتَنَا الْأُولَىٰ وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمُعَذَّبِينَ
verses.translation: [again,] beyond our previous death, and that we shall never [again] be made to suffer?

verses.content: إِنَّ هَـٰذَا لَهُوَ الْفَوْزُ الْعَظِيمُ
verses.translation: Verily, this - this indeed - is the triumph supreme!”

verses.content: لِمِثْلِ هَـٰذَا فَلْيَعْمَلِ الْعَامِلُونَ
verses.translation: For the like of this, then, let them labour, those who labour [in God’s way]!

verses.content: أَذَٰلِكَ خَيْرٌ نُّزُلًا أَمْ شَجَرَةُ الزَّقُّومِ
verses.translation: Is such [a paradise] the better welcome - or the [hellish] tree of deadly fruit?

verses.content: إِنَّا جَعَلْنَاهَا فِتْنَةً لِّلظَّالِمِينَ
verses.translation: Verily, We have caused it to be a trial for evildoers:

verses.content: إِنَّهَا شَجَرَةٌ تَخْرُجُ فِي أَصْلِ الْجَحِيمِ
verses.translation: for, behold, it is a tree that grows in the very heart of the blazing fire [of hell],

verses.content: طَلْعُهَا كَأَنَّهُ رُءُوسُ الشَّيَاطِينِ
verses.translation: its fruit [as repulsive] as satans’ heads;

verses.content: فَإِنَّهُمْ لَآكِلُونَ مِنْهَا فَمَالِئُونَ مِنْهَا الْبُطُونَ
verses.translation: and they [who are lost in evil] are indeed bound to eat thereof, and to fill their bellies therewith.

verses.content: ثُمَّ إِنَّ لَهُمْ عَلَيْهَا لَشَوْبًا مِّنْ حَمِيمٍ
verses.translation: And, behold, above all this they will be confounded with burning des­pair!

verses.content: ثُمَّ إِنَّ مَرْجِعَهُمْ لَإِلَى الْجَحِيمِ
verses.translation: And once again: Verily, the blazing fire is their ultimate goal –

verses.content: إِنَّهُمْ أَلْفَوْا آبَاءَهُمْ ضَالِّينَ
verses.translation: for, behold, they found their forebears on a wrong way,

verses.content: فَهُمْ عَلَىٰ آثَارِهِمْ يُهْرَعُونَ
verses.translation: and [now] they make haste to follow in their footsteps!

verses.content: وَلَقَدْ ضَلَّ قَبْلَهُمْ أَكْثَرُ الْأَوَّلِينَ
verses.translation: Thus, indeed, most of the people of old went astray before them,

verses.content: وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا فِيهِم مُّنذِرِينَ
verses.translation: although, verily, We had sent warners unto them:

verses.content: فَانظُرْ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَاقِبَةُ الْمُنذَرِينَ
verses.translation: and behold what happened in the end to those that had been warned [to no avail]!

verses.content: إِلَّا عِبَادَ اللَّهِ الْمُخْلَصِينَ
verses.translation: EXCEPT for God’s true servants, [most people are apt to go astray.]

verses.content: وَلَقَدْ نَادَانَا نُوحٌ فَلَنِعْمَ الْمُجِيبُونَ
verses.translation: And, indeed, [it was for this reason that] Noah cried unto Us - and how excellent was Our response:

verses.content: وَنَجَّيْنَاهُ وَأَهْلَهُ مِنَ الْكَرْبِ الْعَظِيمِ
verses.translation: for We saved him and his household from that awesome calamity,

verses.content: وَجَعَلْنَا ذُرِّيَّتَهُ هُمُ الْبَاقِينَ
verses.translation: and caused his offspring to endure [on earth];

verses.content: وَتَرَكْنَا عَلَيْهِ فِي الْآخِرِينَ
verses.translation: and We left him thus to be remembered among later generations:

verses.content: سَلَامٌ عَلَىٰ نُوحٍ فِي الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.translation: “Peace be upon Noah throughout all the worlds!”

verses.content: إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي الْمُحْسِنِينَ
verses.translation: Verily, thus do We reward the doers of good –

verses.content: إِنَّهُ مِنْ عِبَادِنَا الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.translation: for he was truly one of our believing servants:

verses.content: ثُمَّ أَغْرَقْنَا الْآخَرِينَ
verses.translation: [and so We saved him and those who followed him] and then We caused the others to drown.

verses.content: وَإِنَّ مِن شِيعَتِهِ لَإِبْرَاهِيمَ
verses.translation: AND, BEHOLD, of his persuasion was Abraham, too,

verses.content: إِذْ جَاءَ رَبَّهُ بِقَلْبٍ سَلِيمٍ
verses.translation: when he turned to his Sustainer with a heart free of evil,

verses.content: إِذْ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوْمِهِ مَاذَا تَعْبُدُونَ
verses.translation: and [thus] spoke to his father and his people: “What is it that you worship?

verses.content: أَئِفْكًا آلِهَةً دُونَ اللَّهِ تُرِيدُونَ
verses.translation: Do you want [to bow down before] a lie - [before] deities other than God?

verses.content: فَمَا ظَنُّكُم بِرَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.translation: What, then, do you think of the Sustainer of all the worlds?”

verses.content: فَنَظَرَ نَظْرَةً فِي النُّجُومِ
verses.translation: Then he cast a glance at the stars,

verses.content: فَقَالَ إِنِّي سَقِيمٌ
verses.translation: and said, “Verily, I am sick [at heart]!”

verses.content: فَتَوَلَّوْا عَنْهُ مُدْبِرِينَ
verses.translation: and at that they turned their backs on him and went away.

verses.content: فَرَاغَ إِلَىٰ آلِهَتِهِمْ فَقَالَ أَلَا تَأْكُلُونَ
verses.translation: Thereupon he approached their gods stealthily and said, “What! You do not eat [of the offerings placed before you]?

verses.content: مَا لَكُمْ لَا تَنطِقُونَ
verses.translation: What is amiss with you that you do not speak?”

verses.content: فَرَاغَ عَلَيْهِمْ ضَرْبًا بِالْيَمِينِ
verses.translation: And then he fell upon them, smiting them with his right hand.

verses.content: فَأَقْبَلُوا إِلَيْهِ يَزِفُّونَ
verses.translation: [But] then the others came towards him hur­riedly [and accused him of his deed].

verses.content: قَالَ أَتَعْبُدُونَ مَا تَنْحِتُونَ
verses.translation: He answered: “Do you worship something that you [yourselves] have carved,

verses.content: وَاللَّهُ خَلَقَكُمْ وَمَا تَعْمَلُونَ
verses.translation: the while it is God who has created you and all your handiwork?”

verses.content: قَالُوا ابْنُوا لَهُ بُنْيَانًا فَأَلْقُوهُ فِي الْجَحِيمِ
verses.translation: They exclaimed: “Build a pyre for him, and cast him into the blazing fire!”

verses.content: فَأَرَادُوا بِهِ كَيْدًا فَجَعَلْنَاهُمُ الْأَسْفَلِينَ
verses.translation: But whereas they sought to do evil unto him, We [frustrated their designs, and thus] brought them low?

verses.content: وَقَالَ إِنِّي ذَاهِبٌ إِلَىٰ رَبِّي سَيَهْدِينِ
verses.translation: And [Abraham] said: “Verily, I shall [leave this land and] go wherever my Sustainer will guide me!”

verses.content: رَبِّ هَبْ لِي مِنَ الصَّالِحِينَ
verses.translation: [And he prayed:] “O my Sustainer! Bestow upon me the gift of [a son who shall be] one of the righteous!” –

verses.content: فَبَشَّرْنَاهُ بِغُلَامٍ حَلِيمٍ
verses.translation: whereupon We gave him the glad tiding of a boy-child gentle [like himself]?

verses.content: فَلَمَّا بَلَغَ مَعَهُ السَّعْيَ قَالَ يَا بُنَيَّ إِنِّي أَرَىٰ فِي الْمَنَامِ أَنِّي أَذْبَحُكَ فَانظُرْ مَاذَا تَرَىٰ ۚ قَالَ يَا أَبَتِ افْعَلْ مَا تُؤْمَرُ ۖ سَتَجِدُنِي إِن شَاءَ اللَّهُ مِنَ الصَّابِرِينَ
verses.translation: And [one day,] when [the child] had become old enough to share in his [father’s] endeavours, the latter said: “O my dear son! I have seen in a dream that I should sacrifice thee: consider, then, what would be thy view!” [Ishmael] answered: “O my father! Do as thou art bidden: thou wilt find me, if God so wills, among those who are patient in adversity!”

verses.content: فَلَمَّا أَسْلَمَا وَتَلَّهُ لِلْجَبِينِ
verses.translation: But as soon as the two had surrendered themselves to [what they thought to be] the will of God, and [Abraham] had laid him down on his face,

verses.content: وَنَادَيْنَاهُ أَن يَا إِبْرَاهِيمُ
verses.translation: We called out to him: “O Abraham,

verses.content: قَدْ صَدَّقْتَ الرُّؤْيَا ۚ إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي الْمُحْسِنِينَ
verses.translation: thou hast already fulfilled [the purpose of] that dream- vision!” Thus, verily, do We reward the doers of good:

verses.content: إِنَّ هَـٰذَا لَهُوَ الْبَلَاءُ الْمُبِينُ
verses.translation: for, behold, all this was indeed a trial, clear in itself.

verses.content: وَفَدَيْنَاهُ بِذِبْحٍ عَظِيمٍ
verses.translation: And We ransomed him with a tremendous sacrifice,

verses.content: وَتَرَكْنَا عَلَيْهِ فِي الْآخِرِينَ
verses.translation: and left him thus to be remembered among later generations:

verses.content: سَلَامٌ عَلَىٰ إِبْرَاهِيمَ
verses.translation: “Peace be upon Abraham!”

verses.content: كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي الْمُحْسِنِينَ
verses.translation: Thus do We reward the doers of good –

verses.content: إِنَّهُ مِنْ عِبَادِنَا الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.translation: for he was truly one of our believing servants.

verses.content: وَبَشَّرْنَاهُ بِإِسْحَاقَ نَبِيًّا مِّنَ الصَّالِحِينَ
verses.translation: And [in time] We gave him the glad tiding of Isaac, [who, too, would be] a prophet, one of the righteous;

verses.content: وَبَارَكْنَا عَلَيْهِ وَعَلَىٰ إِسْحَاقَ ۚ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّتِهِمَا مُحْسِنٌ وَظَالِمٌ لِّنَفْسِهِ مُبِينٌ
verses.translation: and We blessed him and Isaac: but among the offspring of these two there were [des­tined] to be both doers of good and such as would glaringly sin against themselves.

verses.content: وَلَقَدْ مَنَنَّا عَلَىٰ مُوسَىٰ وَهَارُونَ
verses.translation: THUS, INDEED, did We bestow Our favour upon Moses and Aaron;

verses.content: وَنَجَّيْنَاهُمَا وَقَوْمَهُمَا مِنَ الْكَرْبِ الْعَظِيمِ
verses.translation: and We saved them and their people from the awesome calamity [of bondage],

verses.content: وَنَصَرْنَاهُمْ فَكَانُوا هُمُ الْغَالِبِينَ
verses.translation: and succoured them, so that [in the end] it was they who achieved victory.

verses.content: وَآتَيْنَاهُمَا الْكِتَابَ الْمُسْتَبِينَ
verses.translation: And We gave them the divine writ that made [right and wrong] distinct,

verses.content: وَهَدَيْنَاهُمَا الصِّرَاطَ الْمُسْتَقِيمَ
verses.translation: and guided them the straight way,

verses.content: وَتَرَكْنَا عَلَيْهِمَا فِي الْآخِرِينَ
verses.translation: and left them thus to be remem­bered among later generations:

verses.content: سَلَامٌ عَلَىٰ مُوسَىٰ وَهَارُونَ
verses.translation: “Peace be upon Moses and Aaron!”

verses.content: إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي الْمُحْسِنِينَ
verses.translation: Thus do We reward the doers of good –

verses.content: إِنَّهُمَا مِنْ عِبَادِنَا الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.translation: for those two were truly among Our believing ser­vants.

verses.content: وَإِنَّ إِلْيَاسَ لَمِنَ الْمُرْسَلِينَ
verses.translation: AND, BEHOLD, Elijah [too] was indeed one of Our message-bearers

verses.content: إِذْ قَالَ لِقَوْمِهِ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
verses.translation: when he spoke [thus] to his people: “Will you not remain conscious of God?

verses.content: أَتَدْعُونَ بَعْلًا وَتَذَرُونَ أَحْسَنَ الْخَالِقِينَ
verses.translation: Will you invoke Baal and forsake [God,] the best of artisans -

verses.content: اللَّهَ رَبَّكُمْ وَرَبَّ آبَائِكُمُ الْأَوَّلِينَ
verses.translation: God, your Sustainer and the Sustainer of your forebears of old?”

verses.content: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَإِنَّهُمْ لَمُحْضَرُونَ
verses.translation: But they gave him the lie: and therefore they will most surely be arraigned [on Judgment Day],

verses.content: إِلَّا عِبَادَ اللَّهِ الْمُخْلَصِينَ
verses.translation: excepting only [those who were] God’s true servants;

verses.content: وَتَرَكْنَا عَلَيْهِ فِي الْآخِرِينَ
verses.translation: and him We left thus to be remem­bered among later generations:

verses.content: سَلَامٌ عَلَىٰ إِلْ يَاسِينَ
verses.translation: “Peace be upon Elijah and his followers!”

verses.content: إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي الْمُحْسِنِينَ
verses.translation: Verily, thus do We reward the doers of good –

verses.content: إِنَّهُ مِنْ عِبَادِنَا الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.translation: for he was truly one of Our believing servants!

verses.content: وَإِنَّ لُوطًا لَّمِنَ الْمُرْسَلِينَ
verses.translation: AND, BEHOLD, Lot was indeed one of Our mes­sage-bearers;

verses.content: إِذْ نَجَّيْنَاهُ وَأَهْلَهُ أَجْمَعِينَ
verses.translation: [and so,] when [We decreed the doom of his sinful town,] We saved him and his household,

verses.content: إِلَّا عَجُوزًا فِي الْغَابِرِينَ
verses.translation: except an old woman who was among those that stayed behind;

verses.content: ثُمَّ دَمَّرْنَا الْآخَرِينَ
verses.translation: and then We utterly destroyed the others:

verses.content: وَإِنَّكُمْ لَتَمُرُّونَ عَلَيْهِم مُّصْبِحِينَ
verses.translation: and, verily, [to this day] you pass by the remnants of their dwellings at morning-time

verses.content: وَبِاللَّيْلِ ۗ أَفَلَا تَعْقِلُونَ
verses.translation: and by night. Will you not, then, use your reason?

verses.content: وَإِنَّ يُونُسَ لَمِنَ الْمُرْسَلِينَ
verses.translation: AND, BEHOLD, Jonah was indeed one of Our mes­sage-bearers

verses.content: إِذْ أَبَقَ إِلَى الْفُلْكِ الْمَشْحُونِ
verses.translation: when he fled like a runaway slave onto a laden ship.

verses.content: فَسَاهَمَ فَكَانَ مِنَ الْمُدْحَضِينَ
verses.translation: And then they cast lots, and he was the one who lost;

verses.content: فَالْتَقَمَهُ الْحُوتُ وَهُوَ مُلِيمٌ
verses.translation: [and they cast him into the sea,] whereupon the great fish swallowed him, for he had been blameworthy.

verses.content: فَلَوْلَا أَنَّهُ كَانَ مِنَ الْمُسَبِّحِينَ
verses.translation: And had he not been of those who [even in the deep darkness of their distress are able to] extol God’s limitless glory,

verses.content: لَلَبِثَ فِي بَطْنِهِ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ يُبْعَثُونَ
verses.translation: he would indeed have remained in its belly till the Day when all shall be raised from the dead:

verses.content: فَنَبَذْنَاهُ بِالْعَرَاءِ وَهُوَ سَقِيمٌ
verses.translation: but We caused him to be cast forth on a desert shore, sick [at heart] as he was,

verses.content: وَأَنبَتْنَا عَلَيْهِ شَجَرَةً مِّن يَقْطِينٍ
verses.translation: and caused a creeping plant to grow over him [out of the barren soil].

verses.content: وَأَرْسَلْنَاهُ إِلَىٰ مِائَةِ أَلْفٍ أَوْ يَزِيدُونَ
verses.translation: And [then] We sent him [once again] to [his people,] a hundred thousand [souls] or more:

verses.content: فَآمَنُوا فَمَتَّعْنَاهُمْ إِلَىٰ حِينٍ
verses.translation: and [this time] they believed [in him] and so We allowed them to enjoy their life during the time allotted to them?

verses.content: فَاسْتَفْتِهِمْ أَلِرَبِّكَ الْبَنَاتُ وَلَهُمُ الْبَنُونَ
verses.translation: AND NOW ask them to enlighten thee: Has thy Sustainer daughters, whereas they would have [only] sons?

verses.content: أَمْ خَلَقْنَا الْمَلَائِكَةَ إِنَاثًا وَهُمْ شَاهِدُونَ
verses.translation: - or is it that We have created the angels female, and they [who believe them to be divine] have witnessed [that act of creation]?

verses.content: أَلَا إِنَّهُم مِّنْ إِفْكِهِمْ لَيَقُولُونَ
verses.translation: Oh, verily, it is out of their own [inclination to] falsehood that some people assert,

verses.content: وَلَدَ اللَّهُ وَإِنَّهُمْ لَكَاذِبُونَ
verses.translation: “God has begotten [a son]”; and, verily, they are lying [too, when they say],

verses.content: أَصْطَفَى الْبَنَاتِ عَلَى الْبَنِينَ
verses.translation: “He has chosen daughters in preference to sons”!

verses.content: مَا لَكُمْ كَيْفَ تَحْكُمُونَ
verses.translation: What is amiss with you and your judgment?

verses.content: أَفَلَا تَذَكَّرُونَ
verses.translation: Will you not, then, bethink yourselves?

verses.content: أَمْ لَكُمْ سُلْطَانٌ مُّبِينٌ
verses.translation: Or have you, perchance, a clear evidence [for your assertions]?

verses.content: فَأْتُوا بِكِتَابِكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ صَادِقِينَ
verses.translation: Produce, then, that divine writ of yours, if you are speaking the truth!

verses.content: وَجَعَلُوا بَيْنَهُ وَبَيْنَ الْجِنَّةِ نَسَبًا ۚ وَلَقَدْ عَلِمَتِ الْجِنَّةُ إِنَّهُمْ لَمُحْضَرُونَ
verses.translation: And some people have invented a kinship between Him and all manner of invisible forces although [even] these invisible forces know well that, verily, they [who thus blaspheme against God] shall indeed be arraigned [before Him on Judgment Day: for]

verses.content: سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ عَمَّا يَصِفُونَ
verses.translation: limitless is God in His glory, above anything that men may devise by way of definition!

verses.content: إِلَّا عِبَادَ اللَّهِ الْمُخْلَصِينَ
verses.translation: Not thus, however, [behave] God’s true ser­vants:

verses.content: فَإِنَّكُمْ وَمَا تَعْبُدُونَ
verses.translation: for, verily, neither you [blasphemers] nor the objects of your worship

verses.content: مَا أَنتُمْ عَلَيْهِ بِفَاتِنِينَ
verses.translation: can cause anyone to fall prey to your temptation

verses.content: إِلَّا مَنْ هُوَ صَالِ الْجَحِيمِ
verses.translation: unless it be such as rushes towards the blazing fire [of his own accord]!

verses.content: وَمَا مِنَّا إِلَّا لَهُ مَقَامٌ مَّعْلُومٌ
verses.translation: [All forces of nature praise God and say:] “Among us, too, there is none but has a place assigned to it [by Him];

verses.content: وَإِنَّا لَنَحْنُ الصَّافُّونَ
verses.translation: and, verily, we too are ranged [before Him in worship];

verses.content: وَإِنَّا لَنَحْنُ الْمُسَبِّحُونَ
verses.translation: and, verily, we too extol His limitless glory!”

verses.content: وَإِن كَانُوا لَيَقُولُونَ
verses.translation: AND, INDEED, they [who deny the truth] have always been wont to say,

verses.content: لَوْ أَنَّ عِندَنَا ذِكْرًا مِّنَ الْأَوَّلِينَ
verses.translation: “If only we had a tradition [to this effect] from our forebears,

verses.content: لَكُنَّا عِبَادَ اللَّهِ الْمُخْلَصِينَ
verses.translation: we would certainly be true servants of God.”

verses.content: فَكَفَرُوا بِهِ ۖ فَسَوْفَ يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.translation: And yet, [now that this divine writ has been placed before them,] they refuse to acknowledge it as true! In time, however, they will come to know [what it was that they had rejected]:

verses.content: وَلَقَدْ سَبَقَتْ كَلِمَتُنَا لِعِبَادِنَا الْمُرْسَلِينَ
verses.translation: for, long ago has Our word gone forth unto Our servants, the message- bearers,

verses.content: إِنَّهُمْ لَهُمُ الْمَنصُورُونَ
verses.translation: that, verily, they - they indeed - would be succoured,

verses.content: وَإِنَّ جُندَنَا لَهُمُ الْغَالِبُونَ
verses.translation: and that, verily, Our hosts - they indeed - would [in the end] be victorious!

verses.content: فَتَوَلَّ عَنْهُمْ حَتَّىٰ حِينٍ
verses.translation: Hence, turn thou aside for a while from those [who deny the truth],

verses.content: وَأَبْصِرْهُمْ فَسَوْفَ يُبْصِرُونَ
verses.translation: and see them [for what they are]; and in time they [too] will come to see [what they do not see now].

verses.content: أَفَبِعَذَابِنَا يَسْتَعْجِلُونَ
verses.translation: Do they, then, [really] wish that Our chas­tisement be hastened on?

verses.content: فَإِذَا نَزَلَ بِسَاحَتِهِمْ فَسَاءَ صَبَاحُ الْمُنذَرِينَ
verses.translation: But then, once it alights upon them, hapless will be the awakening of those who were warned [to no avail]!

verses.content: وَتَوَلَّ عَنْهُمْ حَتَّىٰ حِينٍ
verses.translation: Hence, turn thou aside for a while from them,

verses.content: وَأَبْصِرْ فَسَوْفَ يُبْصِرُونَ
verses.translation: and see [them for what they are]; and n time they [too] will come to see [what they do not see now].

verses.content: سُبْحَانَ رَبِّكَ رَبِّ الْعِزَّةِ عَمَّا يَصِفُونَ
verses.translation: LIMITLESS in His glory is thy Sustainer, the Lord of almightiness, [exalted] above anything that men may devise by way of definition!

verses.content: وَسَلَامٌ عَلَى الْمُرْسَلِينَ
verses.translation: And peace be upon all His message-bearers!

verses.content: وَالْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.translation: And all praise is due to God alone, the Sus­tainer of all the worlds!

verses.content: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ ص ۚ وَالْقُرْآنِ ذِي الذِّكْرِ
verses.translation: Sad. CONSIDER this Qur’an, endowed with all that one ought to remember!

verses.content: بَلِ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا فِي عِزَّةٍ وَشِقَاقٍ
verses.translation: But nay - they who are bent on denying the truth are lost in [false] pride, and [hence] deeply in the wrong.

verses.content: كَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا مِن قَبْلِهِم مِّن قَرْنٍ فَنَادَوا وَّلَاتَ حِينَ مَنَاصٍ
verses.translation: How many a generation have We destroyed before their time [for this very sin]! And [how] they called [unto Us] when it was too late to escape!

verses.content: وَعَجِبُوا أَن جَاءَهُم مُّنذِرٌ مِّنْهُمْ ۖ وَقَالَ الْكَافِرُونَ هَـٰذَا سَاحِرٌ كَذَّابٌ
verses.translation: Now these [people] deem it strange that a warner should have come unto them from their own midst - and [so] the deniers of the truth are saying: “A [mere] spellbinder is he, a liar!

verses.content: أَجَعَلَ الْآلِهَةَ إِلَـٰهًا وَاحِدًا ۖ إِنَّ هَـٰذَا لَشَيْءٌ عُجَابٌ
verses.translation: Does he claim that all the deities are [but] one God? Verily, a most strange thing is this!”

verses.content: وَانطَلَقَ الْمَلَأُ مِنْهُمْ أَنِ امْشُوا وَاصْبِرُوا عَلَىٰ آلِهَتِكُمْ ۖ إِنَّ هَـٰذَا لَشَيْءٌ يُرَادُ
verses.translation: And their leaders launch forth [thus]: “Go ahead, and hold steadfastly onto your deities: this, behold, is the only thing to do!

verses.content: مَا سَمِعْنَا بِهَـٰذَا فِي الْمِلَّةِ الْآخِرَةِ إِنْ هَـٰذَا إِلَّا اخْتِلَاقٌ
verses.translation: Never did we hear of [a claim like] this in any faith of latter days! It is nothing but [a mortal man’s] invention!

verses.content: أَأُنزِلَ عَلَيْهِ الذِّكْرُ مِن بَيْنِنَا ۚ بَلْ هُمْ فِي شَكٍّ مِّن ذِكْرِي ۖ بَل لَّمَّا يَذُوقُوا عَذَابِ
verses.translation: What! Upon him alone from among all of us should a [divine] reminder have been bestowed from on high?” Nay, but it is My Own reminder that they distrust! Nay, they have not yet tasted the suffering which I do impose!

verses.content: أَمْ عِندَهُمْ خَزَائِنُ رَحْمَةِ رَبِّكَ الْعَزِيزِ الْوَهَّابِ
verses.translation: Or do they [think that they] own the treasures of thy Sustainer’s grace - [the grace] of the Almighty, the Giver of Gifts?

verses.content: أَمْ لَهُم مُّلْكُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا ۖ فَلْيَرْتَقُوا فِي الْأَسْبَابِ
verses.translation: Or [that] the dominion over the heavens and the earth and all that is between them is theirs? Why, then, let them try to ascend [to God-like power] by all [conceivable] means!

verses.content: جُندٌ مَّا هُنَالِكَ مَهْزُومٌ مِّنَ الْأَحْزَابِ
verses.translation: [But] there it is: any and all human beings, however [strongly] leagued together, are bound to suffer defeat [whenever they refuse to accept the truth].

verses.content: كَذَّبَتْ قَبْلَهُمْ قَوْمُ نُوحٍ وَعَادٌ وَفِرْعَوْنُ ذُو الْأَوْتَادِ
verses.translation: To the truth gave the lie aforetime Noah’s people, and [the tribe of] Ad, and Pharaoh of the [many] tent-poles,

verses.content: وَثَمُودُ وَقَوْمُ لُوطٍ وَأَصْحَابُ الْأَيْكَةِ ۚ أُولَـٰئِكَ الْأَحْزَابُ
verses.translation: and [the tribe of] Thamud, and the people of Lot, and the dwellers of the wooded dales [of Madyan]: they all were leagued together, [as it were, in their unbelief:]

verses.content: إِن كُلٌّ إِلَّا كَذَّبَ الرُّسُلَ فَحَقَّ عِقَابِ
verses.translation: not one [was there] but gave the lie to the apostles - and thereupon My retribution fell due.

verses.content: وَمَا يَنظُرُ هَـٰؤُلَاءِ إِلَّا صَيْحَةً وَاحِدَةً مَّا لَهَا مِن فَوَاقٍ
verses.translation: And they [who now deny the truth - they, too,] have but to wait for one single blast [of punishment to overtake them]: it shall not be delayed a whit.

verses.content: وَقَالُوا رَبَّنَا عَجِّل لَّنَا قِطَّنَا قَبْلَ يَوْمِ الْحِسَابِ
verses.translation: As it is, they say [mockingly]: “O our Sus­tainer! Hasten on to us our share [of punishment even] before the Day of Reckoning!”

verses.content: اصْبِرْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَاذْكُرْ عَبْدَنَا دَاوُودَ ذَا الْأَيْدِ ۖ إِنَّهُ أَوَّابٌ
verses.translation: [But] bear thou with patience whatever they may say, and remember Our servant David, him who was endowed with [so much] inner strength! He, verily, would always turn unto Us:

verses.content: إِنَّا سَخَّرْنَا الْجِبَالَ مَعَهُ يُسَبِّحْنَ بِالْعَشِيِّ وَالْإِشْرَاقِ
verses.translation: [and for this,] behold, We caused the mountains to join him in extolling Our limitless glory at eventide and at sun­rise,

verses.content: وَالطَّيْرَ مَحْشُورَةً ۖ كُلٌّ لَّهُ أَوَّابٌ
verses.translation: and [likewise] the birds in their assemblies: [together] they all Would turn again and again unto Him [who had created them].

verses.content: وَشَدَدْنَا مُلْكَهُ وَآتَيْنَاهُ الْحِكْمَةَ وَفَصْلَ الْخِطَابِ
verses.translation: And We streng­thened his dominion, and bestowed upon him wisdom and sagacity in judgment.

verses.content: وَهَلْ أَتَاكَ نَبَأُ الْخَصْمِ إِذْ تَسَوَّرُوا الْمِحْرَابَ
verses.translation: AND YET, has the story of the litigants come within thy ken - [the story of the two] who surmounted the walls of the sanctuary [in which David prayed]?

verses.content: إِذْ دَخَلُوا عَلَىٰ دَاوُودَ فَفَزِعَ مِنْهُمْ ۖ قَالُوا لَا تَخَفْ ۖ خَصْمَانِ بَغَىٰ بَعْضُنَا عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ فَاحْكُم بَيْنَنَا بِالْحَقِّ وَلَا تُشْطِطْ وَاهْدِنَا إِلَىٰ سَوَاءِ الصِّرَاطِ
verses.translation: As they came upon David, and he shrank back in fear from them, they said: “Fear not! [We are but] two litigants. One of us has wronged the other: so judge thou between us with justice, and deviate not from what is right, and show [both of] us the way to rectitude.

verses.content: إِنَّ هَـٰذَا أَخِي لَهُ تِسْعٌ وَتِسْعُونَ نَعْجَةً وَلِيَ نَعْجَةٌ وَاحِدَةٌ فَقَالَ أَكْفِلْنِيهَا وَعَزَّنِي فِي الْخِطَابِ
verses.translation: “Behold, this is my brother: he has ninety-nine ewes, whereas I have [only] one ewe - and yet he said, ‘Make her over to me,’ and forcibly prevailed against me in this [our] dispute.”

verses.content: قَالَ لَقَدْ ظَلَمَكَ بِسُؤَالِ نَعْجَتِكَ إِلَىٰ نِعَاجِهِ ۖ وَإِنَّ كَثِيرًا مِّنَ الْخُلَطَاءِ لَيَبْغِي بَعْضُهُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ إِلَّا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ وَقَلِيلٌ مَّا هُمْ ۗ وَظَنَّ دَاوُودُ أَنَّمَا فَتَنَّاهُ فَاسْتَغْفَرَ رَبَّهُ وَخَرَّ رَاكِعًا وَأَنَابَ ۩
verses.translation: Said [David]: “He has certainly wronged thee by demanding that thy ewe be added to his ewes! Thus, behold, do many kinsmen wrong one another [all] save those who believe [in God] and do righteous deeds: but how few are they!” And [suddenly] David understood that We had tried him: and so he asked his Sustainer to forgive him his sin, and fell down in prostration, and turned unto Him in repentance.

verses.content: فَغَفَرْنَا لَهُ ذَٰلِكَ ۖ وَإِنَّ لَهُ عِندَنَا لَزُلْفَىٰ وَحُسْنَ مَآبٍ
verses.translation: And thereupon We forgave him that [sin]: and, verily, nearness to Us awaits him [in the life to come], and the most beauteous of all goals!

verses.content: يَا دَاوُودُ إِنَّا جَعَلْنَاكَ خَلِيفَةً فِي الْأَرْضِ فَاحْكُم بَيْنَ النَّاسِ بِالْحَقِّ وَلَا تَتَّبِعِ الْهَوَىٰ فَيُضِلَّكَ عَن سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّ الَّذِينَ يَضِلُّونَ عَن سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ لَهُمْ عَذَابٌ شَدِيدٌ بِمَا نَسُوا يَوْمَ الْحِسَابِ
verses.translation: [And We said:] “O David! Behold, We have made thee a [prophet and, thus, Our] vicegerent on earth: judge, then, between men with justice, and do not follow vain desire, lest it lead thee astray from the path of God: verily, for those who go astray from the path of God there is suffering severe in store for having forgotten the Day of Reckoning!”

verses.content: وَمَا خَلَقْنَا السَّمَاءَ وَالْأَرْضَ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا بَاطِلًا ۚ ذَٰلِكَ ظَنُّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا ۚ فَوَيْلٌ لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مِنَ النَّارِ
verses.translation: AND [thus it is:] We have not created heaven and earth and all that is between them without meaning and purpose, as is the surmise of those who are bent on denying the truth: but then, woe from the fire [of hell] unto all who are bent on denying the truth!

verses.content: أَمْ نَجْعَلُ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ كَالْمُفْسِدِينَ فِي الْأَرْضِ أَمْ نَجْعَلُ الْمُتَّقِينَ كَالْفُجَّارِ
verses.translation: [For,] would We treat those who have attained to faith and do righteous deeds in the same manner as [We shall treat] those who spread corruption on earth? Would We treat the God-conscious in the same manner as the wicked?

verses.content: كِتَابٌ أَنزَلْنَاهُ إِلَيْكَ مُبَارَكٌ لِّيَدَّبَّرُوا آيَاتِهِ وَلِيَتَذَكَّرَ أُولُو الْأَلْبَابِ
verses.translation: [All this have We expounded in this] blessed divine writ which We have revealed unto thee, [O Muhammad,] so that men may ponder over its mes­sages, and that those who are endowed with insight may take them to heart.

verses.content: وَوَهَبْنَا لِدَاوُودَ سُلَيْمَانَ ۚ نِعْمَ الْعَبْدُ ۖ إِنَّهُ أَوَّابٌ
verses.translation: AND UNTO DAVID We granted Solomon [as a son - and] how excellent a servant [of Ours he grew up to be]! Behold, he would always turn unto Us -

verses.content: إِذْ عُرِضَ عَلَيْهِ بِالْعَشِيِّ الصَّافِنَاتُ الْجِيَادُ
verses.translation: [and even] when, towards the close of day, nobly-bred, swift-footed steeds were brought before him,

verses.content: فَقَالَ إِنِّي أَحْبَبْتُ حُبَّ الْخَيْرِ عَن ذِكْرِ رَبِّي حَتَّىٰ تَوَارَتْ بِالْحِجَابِ
verses.translation: he would say, “Verily, I have come to love the love of all that is good because I bear my Sustainer in mind!” [repeating these words as the steeds raced away,] until they were hidden by the veil [of distance - whereupon he would command],

verses.content: رُدُّوهَا عَلَيَّ ۖ فَطَفِقَ مَسْحًا بِالسُّوقِ وَالْأَعْنَاقِ
verses.translation: “Bring them back unto me!”- and would [lovingly] stroke their legs and their necks.

verses.content: وَلَقَدْ فَتَنَّا سُلَيْمَانَ وَأَلْقَيْنَا عَلَىٰ كُرْسِيِّهِ جَسَدًا ثُمَّ أَنَابَ
verses.translation: But [ere this], indeed, We had tried Solomon by placing upon his throne a [lifeless] body; and thereupon he turned [towards Us; and]

verses.content: قَالَ رَبِّ اغْفِرْ لِي وَهَبْ لِي مُلْكًا لَّا يَنبَغِي لِأَحَدٍ مِّن بَعْدِي ۖ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ الْوَهَّابُ
verses.translation: he prayed: “O my Sustainer! Forgive me my sins, and bestow upon me the gift of a kingdom which may not suit anyone after me: verily, Thou alone art a giver of gifts!”

verses.content: فَسَخَّرْنَا لَهُ الرِّيحَ تَجْرِي بِأَمْرِهِ رُخَاءً حَيْثُ أَصَابَ
verses.translation: And so We made subservient to him the wind, so that it gently sped at his behest whithersoever he willed,

verses.content: وَالشَّيَاطِينَ كُلَّ بَنَّاءٍ وَغَوَّاصٍ
verses.translation: as well as all the rebellious forces [that We made to work for him] - every kind of builder and diver -

verses.content: وَآخَرِينَ مُقَرَّنِينَ فِي الْأَصْفَادِ
verses.translation: and others linked together in fetters.

verses.content: هَـٰذَا عَطَاؤُنَا فَامْنُنْ أَوْ أَمْسِكْ بِغَيْرِ حِسَابٍ
verses.translation: [And We told him:] “This is Our gift, for thee to bestow freely on others, or to withhold, without [having to render] account!”

verses.content: وَإِنَّ لَهُ عِندَنَا لَزُلْفَىٰ وَحُسْنَ مَآبٍ
verses.translation: And, verily, nearness to Us awaits him [in the life to come], and the most beauteous of all goals!

verses.content: وَاذْكُرْ عَبْدَنَا أَيُّوبَ إِذْ نَادَىٰ رَبَّهُ أَنِّي مَسَّنِيَ الشَّيْطَانُ بِنُصْبٍ وَعَذَابٍ
verses.translation: AND CALL to mind Our servant Job, [how it was] when he cried out to his Sustainer, “Behold, Satan has afflicted me with [utter] weariness and suffering!”

verses.content: ارْكُضْ بِرِجْلِكَ ۖ هَـٰذَا مُغْتَسَلٌ بَارِدٌ وَشَرَابٌ
verses.translation: [and thereupon was told:] “Strike [the ground] with thy foot: here is cool water to wash with and to drink!”

verses.content: وَوَهَبْنَا لَهُ أَهْلَهُ وَمِثْلَهُم مَّعَهُمْ رَحْمَةً مِّنَّا وَذِكْرَىٰ لِأُولِي الْأَلْبَابِ
verses.translation: And We bestowed upon him new offspring, doubling their number as an act of grace from Us, and as a reminder unto all who are endowed with insight.

verses.content: وَخُذْ بِيَدِكَ ضِغْثًا فَاضْرِب بِّهِ وَلَا تَحْنَثْ ۗ إِنَّا وَجَدْنَاهُ صَابِرًا ۚ نِّعْمَ الْعَبْدُ ۖ إِنَّهُ أَوَّابٌ
verses.translation: [And finally We told him:] “Now take in thy hand a small bunch of grass, and strike therewith, and thou wilt not break thine oath!” for, verily, We found him full of patience in adversity: how excellent a servant [of Ours], who, behold, would always turn unto Us!

verses.content: وَاذْكُرْ عِبَادَنَا إِبْرَاهِيمَ وَإِسْحَاقَ وَيَعْقُوبَ أُولِي الْأَيْدِي وَالْأَبْصَارِ
verses.translation: AND CALL to mind Our servants Abraham and Isaac and Jacob, [all of them] endowed with inner strength and vision:

verses.content: إِنَّا أَخْلَصْنَاهُم بِخَالِصَةٍ ذِكْرَى الدَّارِ
verses.translation: for, verily, We purified them by means of a thought most pure: the remembrance of the life to come.

verses.content: وَإِنَّهُمْ عِندَنَا لَمِنَ الْمُصْطَفَيْنَ الْأَخْيَارِ
verses.translation: And, behold, in Our sight they were indeed among the elect, the truly good!

verses.content: وَاذْكُرْ إِسْمَاعِيلَ وَالْيَسَعَ وَذَا الْكِفْلِ ۖ وَكُلٌّ مِّنَ الْأَخْيَارِ
verses.translation: And call to mind Ishmael and Elisha, and every one who [like them] has pledged himself [unto Us]: for, each of them was of the truly good!

verses.content: هَـٰذَا ذِكْرٌ ۚ وَإِنَّ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ لَحُسْنَ مَآبٍ
verses.translation: LET [all] this be a reminder [to those who believe in God] - for, verily, the most beauteous of all goals awaits the God-conscious:

verses.content: جَنَّاتِ عَدْنٍ مُّفَتَّحَةً لَّهُمُ الْأَبْوَابُ
verses.translation: gardens of perpetual bliss, with gates wide-open to them,

verses.content: مُتَّكِئِينَ فِيهَا يَدْعُونَ فِيهَا بِفَاكِهَةٍ كَثِيرَةٍ وَشَرَابٍ
verses.translation: wherein they will recline, [and] wherein they may [freely] call for many a fruit and drink,

verses.content: وَعِندَهُمْ قَاصِرَاتُ الطَّرْفِ أَتْرَابٌ
verses.translation: having beside them well-matched mates of modest gaze.”

verses.content: هَـٰذَا مَا تُوعَدُونَ لِيَوْمِ الْحِسَابِ
verses.translation: This is what you are promised for the Day of Reckoning:

verses.content: إِنَّ هَـٰذَا لَرِزْقُنَا مَا لَهُ مِن نَّفَادٍ
verses.translation: this, verily, shall be Our provision [for you], with no end to it!

verses.content: هَـٰذَا ۚ وَإِنَّ لِلطَّاغِينَ لَشَرَّ مَآبٍ
verses.translation: All this [for the righteous]: but, verily, the most evil of all goals awaits those who are wont to transgress the bounds of what is right:

verses.content: جَهَنَّمَ يَصْلَوْنَهَا فَبِئْسَ الْمِهَادُ
verses.translation: hell will they have to endure - and how vile a resting-place!

verses.content: هَـٰذَا فَلْيَذُوقُوهُ حَمِيمٌ وَغَسَّاقٌ
verses.translation: This, [then, for them -] so let them taste it: burning despair and ice-cold darkness

verses.content: وَآخَرُ مِن شَكْلِهِ أَزْوَاجٌ
verses.translation: and, coupled with it, further [suffering] of a similar nature.

verses.content: هَـٰذَا فَوْجٌ مُّقْتَحِمٌ مَّعَكُمْ ۖ لَا مَرْحَبًا بِهِمْ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ صَالُو النَّارِ
verses.translation: [And they will say to one another: “Do you see] this crowd of people who rushed headlong [into sin] with you? No welcome to them! Verily, they [too] shall have to endure the fire!”

verses.content: قَالُوا بَلْ أَنتُمْ لَا مَرْحَبًا بِكُمْ ۖ أَنتُمْ قَدَّمْتُمُوهُ لَنَا ۖ فَبِئْسَ الْقَرَارُ
verses.translation: [And] they [who had been seduced] will exclaim: “Nay, but it is you! No welcome to you! It is you who have prepared this for us: and how vile a state to abide in!”

verses.content: قَالُوا رَبَّنَا مَن قَدَّمَ لَنَا هَـٰذَا فَزِدْهُ عَذَابًا ضِعْفًا فِي النَّارِ
verses.translation: [And] they will pray: “O our Sustainer! Who­ever has prepared this for us, double Thou his suffering in the fire!”

verses.content: وَقَالُوا مَا لَنَا لَا نَرَىٰ رِجَالًا كُنَّا نَعُدُّهُم مِّنَ الْأَشْرَارِ
verses.translation: And they will add: “How is it that we do not see [here any of the] men whom we were wont to count among the wicked,

verses.content: أَتَّخَذْنَاهُمْ سِخْرِيًّا أَمْ زَاغَتْ عَنْهُمُ الْأَبْصَارُ
verses.translation: [and] whom we made the target of our derision? Or is it that [they are here, and] our eyes have missed them?”

verses.content: إِنَّ ذَٰلِكَ لَحَقٌّ تَخَاصُمُ أَهْلِ النَّارِ
verses.translation: Such, behold, will in truth be the [confusion and] mutual wrangling of the people of the fire!

verses.content: قُلْ إِنَّمَا أَنَا مُنذِرٌ ۖ وَمَا مِنْ إِلَـٰهٍ إِلَّا اللَّهُ الْوَاحِدُ الْقَهَّارُ
verses.translation: SAY [O Muhammad]: “I am only a warner; and there is no deity whatever save God, the One, who holds absolute sway over all that exists,

verses.content: رَبُّ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا الْعَزِيزُ الْغَفَّارُ
verses.translation: the Sustainer of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, the Almighty, the All-Forgiving!”

verses.content: قُلْ هُوَ نَبَأٌ عَظِيمٌ
verses.translation: Say: “This is a message tremendous:

verses.content: أَنتُمْ عَنْهُ مُعْرِضُونَ
verses.translation: [how can] you turn away from it?”

verses.content: مَا كَانَ لِيَ مِنْ عِلْمٍ بِالْمَلَإِ الْأَعْلَىٰ إِذْ يَخْتَصِمُونَ
verses.translation: [Say, O Muhammad:] “No knowledge would I have had of [what passed among] the host on high when they argued [against the creation of man],

verses.content: إِن يُوحَىٰ إِلَيَّ إِلَّا أَنَّمَا أَنَا نَذِيرٌ مُّبِينٌ
verses.translation: had it not been revealed unto me [by God] - to no other end than that I might convey [unto you] a plain warning.

verses.content: إِذْ قَالَ رَبُّكَ لِلْمَلَائِكَةِ إِنِّي خَالِقٌ بَشَرًا مِّن طِينٍ
verses.translation: [For,] lo, thy Sustainer said unto the angels: “Behold, I am about to create a human being out of clay;

verses.content: فَإِذَا سَوَّيْتُهُ وَنَفَخْتُ فِيهِ مِن رُّوحِي فَقَعُوا لَهُ سَاجِدِينَ
verses.translation: and when I have formed him fully and breathed into him of My spirit, fall you down before him in prostration!”

verses.content: فَسَجَدَ الْمَلَائِكَةُ كُلُّهُمْ أَجْمَعُونَ
verses.translation: Thereupon the angels prostrated themselves, all of them together,

verses.content: إِلَّا إِبْلِيسَ اسْتَكْبَرَ وَكَانَ مِنَ الْكَافِرِينَ
verses.translation: save Iblis: he gloried in his arrogance, and [thus] became one of those who deny the truth.

verses.content: قَالَ يَا إِبْلِيسُ مَا مَنَعَكَ أَن تَسْجُدَ لِمَا خَلَقْتُ بِيَدَيَّ ۖ أَسْتَكْبَرْتَ أَمْ كُنتَ مِنَ الْعَالِينَ
verses.translation: Said He: “O Iblis! What has kept thee from prostrating thyself before that [being] which I have created with My hands? Art thou too proud [to bow down before another created being], or art thou of those who think [only] of themselves as high?”

verses.content: قَالَ أَنَا خَيْرٌ مِّنْهُ ۖ خَلَقْتَنِي مِن نَّارٍ وَخَلَقْتَهُ مِن طِينٍ
verses.translation: Answered [Iblis]: “I am better than he: Thou hast created me out of fire, whereas him Thou hast created out of clay.”

verses.content: قَالَ فَاخْرُجْ مِنْهَا فَإِنَّكَ رَجِيمٌ
verses.translation: Said He: “Go forth, then, from this [angelic state] - for, behold, thou art henceforth accursed,

verses.content: وَإِنَّ عَلَيْكَ لَعْنَتِي إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ الدِّينِ
verses.translation: and My rejection shall be thy due until the Day of Judgment!”

verses.content: قَالَ رَبِّ فَأَنظِرْنِي إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ يُبْعَثُونَ
verses.translation: Said [Iblis]: “Then, O my Sustainer, grant me a respite till the Day when all shall be raised from the dead!”

verses.content: قَالَ فَإِنَّكَ مِنَ الْمُنظَرِينَ
verses.translation: Answered He: “Verily, so [be it:] thou shalt be among those who are granted respite

verses.content: إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ الْوَقْتِ الْمَعْلُومِ
verses.translation: till the Day the time whereof is known [only to Me].”

verses.content: قَالَ فَبِعِزَّتِكَ لَأُغْوِيَنَّهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
verses.translation: [Whereupon Iblis] said: “Then [I swear] by Thy very might: I shall most certainly beguile them all into grievous error –

verses.content: إِلَّا عِبَادَكَ مِنْهُمُ الْمُخْلَصِينَ
verses.translation: [all] save such of them as are truly Thy servants!”

verses.content: قَالَ فَالْحَقُّ وَالْحَقَّ أَقُولُ
verses.translation: [And God] said: “This, then, is the truth! And this truth do I state:

verses.content: لَأَمْلَأَنَّ جَهَنَّمَ مِنكَ وَمِمَّن تَبِعَكَ مِنْهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
verses.translation: Most certainly will I fill hell with thee and such of them as shall follow thee, all together!”

verses.content: قُلْ مَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ وَمَا أَنَا مِنَ الْمُتَكَلِّفِينَ
verses.translation: SAY [O Prophet]: “No reward whatever do I ask of you for this [message]; and I am not one of those who claim to be what they are not.

verses.content: إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا ذِكْرٌ لِّلْعَالَمِينَ
verses.translation: This [divine writ], behold, is no less than a reminder to all the worlds —

verses.content: وَلَتَعْلَمُنَّ نَبَأَهُ بَعْدَ حِينٍ
verses.translation: and you will most certainly grasp its purport after a lapse of time!”

verses.content: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ تَنزِيلُ الْكِتَابِ مِنَ اللَّهِ الْعَزِيزِ الْحَكِيمِ
verses.translation: THE BESTOWAL from on high of this divine writ issues from God, the Almighty, the Wise:

verses.content: إِنَّا أَنزَلْنَا إِلَيْكَ الْكِتَابَ بِالْحَقِّ فَاعْبُدِ اللَّهَ مُخْلِصًا لَّهُ الدِّينَ
verses.translation: for, behold, it is We who have bestowed this revela­tion upon thee from on high, setting forth the truth: so worship Him, sincere in thy faith in Him alone!

verses.content: أَلَا لِلَّهِ الدِّينُ الْخَالِصُ ۚ وَالَّذِينَ اتَّخَذُوا مِن دُونِهِ أَوْلِيَاءَ مَا نَعْبُدُهُمْ إِلَّا لِيُقَرِّبُونَا إِلَى اللَّهِ زُلْفَىٰ إِنَّ اللَّهَ يَحْكُمُ بَيْنَهُمْ فِي مَا هُمْ فِيهِ يَخْتَلِفُونَ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَا يَهْدِي مَنْ هُوَ كَاذِبٌ كَفَّارٌ
verses.translation: Is it not to God alone that all sincere faith is due? And yet, they who take for their protectors aught beside Him [are wont to say], “We worship them for no other reason than that they bring us nearer to God.” Behold, God will judge between them [on Resur­rection Day] with regard to all wherein they differ [from the truth]: for, verily, God does not grace with His guidance anyone who is bent on lying [to himself and is] stubbornly ingrate!

verses.content: لَّوْ أَرَادَ اللَّهُ أَن يَتَّخِذَ وَلَدًا لَّاصْطَفَىٰ مِمَّا يَخْلُقُ مَا يَشَاءُ ۚ سُبْحَانَهُ ۖ هُوَ اللَّهُ الْوَاحِدُ الْقَهَّارُ
verses.translation: Had God willed to take Unto Himself a son, He could have chosen anyone that He wanted out of whatever He has created - [but] limitless is He in His glory! He is the One God, the One who holds absolute sway over all that exists!

verses.content: خَلَقَ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ بِالْحَقِّ ۖ يُكَوِّرُ اللَّيْلَ عَلَى النَّهَارِ وَيُكَوِّرُ النَّهَارَ عَلَى اللَّيْلِ ۖ وَسَخَّرَ الشَّمْسَ وَالْقَمَرَ ۖ كُلٌّ يَجْرِي لِأَجَلٍ مُّسَمًّى ۗ أَلَا هُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الْغَفَّارُ
verses.translation: He it is who has created the heavens and the earth in accordance with [an inner] truth. He causes the night to flow into the day, and causes the day to flow into the night; and He has made the sun and the moon subservient [to His laws], each running its course for a term set [by Him]. Is not He the Almighty, the All-Forgiving?

verses.content: خَلَقَكُم مِّن نَّفْسٍ وَاحِدَةٍ ثُمَّ جَعَلَ مِنْهَا زَوْجَهَا وَأَنزَلَ لَكُم مِّنَ الْأَنْعَامِ ثَمَانِيَةَ أَزْوَاجٍ ۚ يَخْلُقُكُمْ فِي بُطُونِ أُمَّهَاتِكُمْ خَلْقًا مِّن بَعْدِ خَلْقٍ فِي ظُلُمَاتٍ ثَلَاثٍ ۚ ذَٰلِكُمُ اللَّهُ رَبُّكُمْ لَهُ الْمُلْكُ ۖ لَا إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۖ فَأَنَّىٰ تُصْرَفُونَ
verses.translation: He has created you [all] out of one living entity, and out of it fashioned its mate; and he has be­stowed upon you four kinds of cattle of either sex; [and] He creates you in your mothers’ wombs, one act of creation after another, in threefold depths of darkness. Thus is God, your Sustainer: unto Him belongs all dominion: there is no deity save Him: how, then, can you lose sight of the truth?

verses.content: إِن تَكْفُرُوا فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ غَنِيٌّ عَنكُمْ ۖ وَلَا يَرْضَىٰ لِعِبَادِهِ الْكُفْرَ ۖ وَإِن تَشْكُرُوا يَرْضَهُ لَكُمْ ۗ وَلَا تَزِرُ وَازِرَةٌ وِزْرَ أُخْرَىٰ ۗ ثُمَّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكُم مَّرْجِعُكُمْ فَيُنَبِّئُكُم بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ ۚ إِنَّهُ عَلِيمٌ بِذَاتِ الصُّدُورِ
verses.translation: If you are ingrate behold, God has no need of you; none the less, He does not approve of in­gratitude in His servants: whereas, if you show grati­tude, He approves it in you. And no bearer of burdens shall be made to bear another’s burden. In time, unto your Sustainer you all must return, and then He will make you [truly] understand all that you were doing [in life]: for, verily, He has full knowledge of what is in the hearts [of men].

verses.content: وَإِذَا مَسَّ الْإِنسَانَ ضُرٌّ دَعَا رَبَّهُ مُنِيبًا إِلَيْهِ ثُمَّ إِذَا خَوَّلَهُ نِعْمَةً مِّنْهُ نَسِيَ مَا كَانَ يَدْعُو إِلَيْهِ مِن قَبْلُ وَجَعَلَ لِلَّهِ أَندَادًا لِّيُضِلَّ عَن سَبِيلِهِ ۚ قُلْ تَمَتَّعْ بِكُفْرِكَ قَلِيلًا ۖ إِنَّكَ مِنْ أَصْحَابِ النَّارِ
verses.translation: NOW [thus it is:] when affliction befalls man, he is likely to cry out to his Sustainer, turning unto Him [for help]; but as soon as He has bestowed upon him a boon by His grace, he forgets Him whom he in­voked before, and claims that there are other powers that could rival God - and thus leads [others] astray from His path. Say [unto him who sins in this way]: “Enjoy thyself for a while in this thy denial of the truth; [yet,] verily, thou art of those who are destined for the fire!

verses.content: أَمَّنْ هُوَ قَانِتٌ آنَاءَ اللَّيْلِ سَاجِدًا وَقَائِمًا يَحْذَرُ الْآخِرَةَ وَيَرْجُو رَحْمَةَ رَبِّهِ ۗ قُلْ هَلْ يَسْتَوِي الَّذِينَ يَعْلَمُونَ وَالَّذِينَ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ ۗ إِنَّمَا يَتَذَكَّرُ أُولُو الْأَلْبَابِ
verses.translation: Or [dost thou deem thyself equal to] one who devoutly worships [God] throughout the night, prostrating himself or standing [in prayer], ever- mindful of the life to come, and hoping for his Sustainer’s grace?” Say: “Can they who know and they who do not know be deemed equal?” [But] only they who are endowed with insight keep this in mind!

verses.content: قُلْ يَا عِبَادِ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا اتَّقُوا رَبَّكُمْ ۚ لِلَّذِينَ أَحْسَنُوا فِي هَـٰذِهِ الدُّنْيَا حَسَنَةٌ ۗ وَأَرْضُ اللَّهِ وَاسِعَةٌ ۗ إِنَّمَا يُوَفَّى الصَّابِرُونَ أَجْرَهُم بِغَيْرِ حِسَابٍ
verses.translation: Say: “[Thus speaks God:] ‘O you servants of Mine who have attained to faith! Be conscious of your Sustainer! Ultimate good awaits those who per­severe in doing good in this world. And [remember:] wide is God’s earth, [and,] verily, they who are patient in adversity will be given their reward in full, beyond all reckoning!’”

verses.content: قُلْ إِنِّي أُمِرْتُ أَنْ أَعْبُدَ اللَّهَ مُخْلِصًا لَّهُ الدِّينَ
verses.translation: Say [O Muhammad]: “Behold, I am bidden to worship God, sincere in my faith in Him alone;

verses.content: وَأُمِرْتُ لِأَنْ أَكُونَ أَوَّلَ الْمُسْلِمِينَ
verses.translation: and I am bidden to be foremost among those who surrender themselves unto God.”

verses.content: قُلْ إِنِّي أَخَافُ إِنْ عَصَيْتُ رَبِّي عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
verses.translation: Say: “Behold, I would dread, were I to rebel against my Sustainer, the suffering [which would befall me] on that awesome Day [of Judgment].”

verses.content: قُلِ اللَّهَ أَعْبُدُ مُخْلِصًا لَّهُ دِينِي
verses.translation: Say: “God alone do I worship, sincere in my faith in Him alone -

verses.content: فَاعْبُدُوا مَا شِئْتُم مِّن دُونِهِ ۗ قُلْ إِنَّ الْخَاسِرِينَ الَّذِينَ خَسِرُوا أَنفُسَهُمْ وَأَهْلِيهِمْ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ ۗ أَلَا ذَٰلِكَ هُوَ الْخُسْرَانُ الْمُبِينُ
verses.translation: and [it is up to you, O sinners, to] worship whatever you please instead of Him!” Say: “Behold, the [true] losers will be they who shall have lost their own selves and their kith and kin on Resurrection Day: for is not this, this, the [most] obvious loss?

verses.content: لَهُم مِّن فَوْقِهِمْ ظُلَلٌ مِّنَ النَّارِ وَمِن تَحْتِهِمْ ظُلَلٌ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ يُخَوِّفُ اللَّهُ بِهِ عِبَادَهُ ۚ يَا عِبَادِ فَاتَّقُونِ
verses.translation: Clouds of fire will they have above them, and [similar] clouds beneath them…” In this way does God imbue His servants with fear. O you servants of Mine! Be, then, conscious of Me -

verses.content: وَالَّذِينَ اجْتَنَبُوا الطَّاغُوتَ أَن يَعْبُدُوهَا وَأَنَابُوا إِلَى اللَّهِ لَهُمُ الْبُشْرَىٰ ۚ فَبَشِّرْ عِبَادِ
verses.translation: seeing that for those who shun the powers of evil lest they [be tempted to] worship them, and turn unto God instead, there is the glad tiding [of happiness in the life to come]. Give, then, this glad tiding to [those of] My ser­vants

verses.content: الَّذِينَ يَسْتَمِعُونَ الْقَوْلَ فَيَتَّبِعُونَ أَحْسَنَهُ ۚ أُولَـٰئِكَ الَّذِينَ هَدَاهُمُ اللَّهُ ۖ وَأُولَـٰئِكَ هُمْ أُولُو الْأَلْبَابِ
verses.translation: who listen [closely] to all that is said, and follow the best of it: [for] it is they whom God has graced with His guidance, and it is they who are [truly] endowed with insight!

verses.content: أَفَمَنْ حَقَّ عَلَيْهِ كَلِمَةُ الْعَذَابِ أَفَأَنتَ تُنقِذُ مَن فِي النَّارِ
verses.translation: On the other hand, could one on whom [God’s] sentence of suffering has been passed [be rescued by man]? Couldst thou, perchance, save one who is [already, as it were,] in the fire?

verses.content: لَـٰكِنِ الَّذِينَ اتَّقَوْا رَبَّهُمْ لَهُمْ غُرَفٌ مِّن فَوْقِهَا غُرَفٌ مَّبْنِيَّةٌ تَجْرِي مِن تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ ۖ وَعْدَ اللَّهِ ۖ لَا يُخْلِفُ اللَّهُ الْمِيعَادَ
verses.translation: As against this they who of their Sustainer are conscious shall [in the life to come] have man­sions raised upon mansions high, beneath which run­ning waters flow: [this is] God’s promise - [and] never does God fail to fulfill His promise.

verses.content: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّ اللَّهَ أَنزَلَ مِنَ السَّمَاءِ مَاءً فَسَلَكَهُ يَنَابِيعَ فِي الْأَرْضِ ثُمَّ يُخْرِجُ بِهِ زَرْعًا مُّخْتَلِفًا أَلْوَانُهُ ثُمَّ يَهِيجُ فَتَرَاهُ مُصْفَرًّا ثُمَّ يَجْعَلُهُ حُطَامًا ۚ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَذِكْرَىٰ لِأُولِي الْأَلْبَابِ
verses.translation: ART THOU NOT aware that it is God who sends down water from the skies, and then causes it to travel through the earth in the shape of springs? And then He brings forth thereby herbage of various hues; and then it withers, and thou canst see it turn yellow; and in the end He causes it to crumble to dust. Verily, in [all] this there is indeed a reminder to those who are endowed with insight!

verses.content: أَفَمَن شَرَحَ اللَّهُ صَدْرَهُ لِلْإِسْلَامِ فَهُوَ عَلَىٰ نُورٍ مِّن رَّبِّهِ ۚ فَوَيْلٌ لِّلْقَاسِيَةِ قُلُوبُهُم مِّن ذِكْرِ اللَّهِ ۚ أُولَـٰئِكَ فِي ضَلَالٍ مُّبِينٍ
verses.translation: Could, then, one whose bosom God has opened wide with willingness towards self-surrender unto Him, so that he is illumined by a light [that flows] from his Sustainer, [be likened to the blind and deaf of heart]? Woe, then, unto those whose hearts are hardened against all remembrance of God! They are most obviously lost in error!

verses.content: اللَّهُ نَزَّلَ أَحْسَنَ الْحَدِيثِ كِتَابًا مُّتَشَابِهًا مَّثَانِيَ تَقْشَعِرُّ مِنْهُ جُلُودُ الَّذِينَ يَخْشَوْنَ رَبَّهُمْ ثُمَّ تَلِينُ جُلُودُهُمْ وَقُلُوبُهُمْ إِلَىٰ ذِكْرِ اللَّهِ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ هُدَى اللَّهِ يَهْدِي بِهِ مَن يَشَاءُ ۚ وَمَن يُضْلِلِ اللَّهُ فَمَا لَهُ مِنْ هَادٍ
verses.translation: God bestows from on high the best of all teachings in the shape of a divine writ fully consistent within itself, repeating each statement [of the truth] in manifold forms [a divine writ] whereat shiver the skins of all who of their Sustainer stand in awe: [but] in the end their skins and their hearts do soften at the remembrance of [the grace of] God. Such is God’s guidance: He guides therewith him that wills [to be guided] whereas he whom God lets go astray can never find any guide

verses.content: أَفَمَن يَتَّقِي بِوَجْهِهِ سُوءَ الْعَذَابِ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ ۚ وَقِيلَ لِلظَّالِمِينَ ذُوقُوا مَا كُنتُمْ تَكْسِبُونَ
verses.translation: Could, then, one who shall have nothing but is [bare] face to protect him from the awful suffering [that will befall him] on Resurrection Day [be likened to the God-conscious]? [On that Day,] the evildoers will be told: “Taste [now] what you have earned [in life]!”

verses.content: كَذَّبَ الَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ فَأَتَاهُمُ الْعَذَابُ مِنْ حَيْثُ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ
verses.translation: Those who lived before them did [too] give the lie to the truth - whereupon suffering befell them without their having perceived whence it came:

verses.content: فَأَذَاقَهُمُ اللَّهُ الْخِزْيَ فِي الْحَيَاةِ الدُّنْيَا ۖ وَلَعَذَابُ الْآخِرَةِ أَكْبَرُ ۚ لَوْ كَانُوا يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.translation: and thus God let them taste ignominy [even] in the life of this world. Yet [how] much greater will be the [sinners’] suffering in the life to come - if they [who now deny the truth] but knew it!

verses.content: وَلَقَدْ ضَرَبْنَا لِلنَّاسِ فِي هَـٰذَا الْقُرْآنِ مِن كُلِّ مَثَلٍ لَّعَلَّهُمْ يَتَذَكَّرُونَ
verses.translation: THUS, INDEED, have We propounded unto men all kinds of parables in this Qur’an, so that they might bethink themselves; [and We have revealed it]

verses.content: قُرْآنًا عَرَبِيًّا غَيْرَ ذِي عِوَجٍ لَّعَلَّهُمْ يَتَّقُونَ
verses.translation: as a discourse in the Arabic tongue, free of all devious­ness, so that they might become conscious of God.

verses.content: ضَرَبَ اللَّهُ مَثَلًا رَّجُلًا فِيهِ شُرَكَاءُ مُتَشَاكِسُونَ وَرَجُلًا سَلَمًا لِّرَجُلٍ هَلْ يَسْتَوِيَانِ مَثَلًا ۚ الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ ۚ بَلْ أَكْثَرُهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.translation: [To this end,] God sets forth a parable: A man who has for his masters several partners, [all of them] at variance with one another, and a man depending wholly on one person: can these two be deemed equal as regards their condition? [Nay,] all praise is due to God [alone]: but most of them do not understand this.

verses.content: إِنَّكَ مَيِّتٌ وَإِنَّهُم مَّيِّتُونَ
verses.translation: Yet, verily, thou art bound to die, [O Muhammad,] and, verily, they, too, are bound to die:

verses.content: ثُمَّ إِنَّكُمْ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ عِندَ رَبِّكُمْ تَخْتَصِمُونَ
verses.translation: and then, behold, on the Day of Resurrection you all shall place your dispute before your Sustainer.

verses.content: فَمَنْ أَظْلَمُ مِمَّن كَذَبَ عَلَى اللَّهِ وَكَذَّبَ بِالصِّدْقِ إِذْ جَاءَهُ ۚ أَلَيْسَ فِي جَهَنَّمَ مَثْوًى لِّلْكَافِرِينَ
verses.translation: And who could be more wicked than he who invents lies about God? and gives the lie to the truth as soon as it has been placed before him? Is not hell the [proper] abode for all who deny the truth?

verses.content: وَالَّذِي جَاءَ بِالصِّدْقِ وَصَدَّقَ بِهِ ۙ أُولَـٰئِكَ هُمُ الْمُتَّقُونَ
verses.translation: But he who brings the truth, and he who wholeheartedly accepts it as true - it is they, they, who are [truly] conscious of Him!

verses.content: لَهُم مَّا يَشَاءُونَ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ جَزَاءُ الْمُحْسِنِينَ
verses.translation: All that they have ever yearned for awaits them with their Sustainer: such will be the reward of the doers of good.
